messages.title: A message from Steve Sollitt
messages.content: Dear Resident, As someone born and bred in Hampshire, I promise to work FULL TIME as your next MP. I intend to spend as much time as possible in Havant, as well as fighting for you in the corridors of power. I will be a strong voice for YOU in Parliament, concentrating on your priorities. I will fight for the services that matter to you. I will get investment in the NHS, extending free school meals to all primary-aged children, raising the personal tax allowance further, and helping young families onto the housing ladder. Please vote for ME on May 7th to represent YOU in Parliament. Yours, Steve

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Fighting for services that matter, including investment in the NHS, extending free school meals to all primary-aged children, raising the personal tax allowance, and helping young families onto the housing ladder.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Only the Lib Dems can beat the Tories in the Havant Constituency. It's between the Lib Dems & Tories in this constituency!

issues.economy: For a FAIRER society and a STRONGER economy
issues.education: Over 2 million apprenticeships have been created nationally since 2010, while in Havant, 2,300 workers will benefit from the adult education of the National Minimum Wage.
issues.health: Your Health - I will fight for the services that matter to you. I will get investment in the NHS.

housing.content: Helping young families onto the housing ladder.

leaflet.personalStatement: I promise to work FULL TIME as your next MP. I will be a strong voice for YOU in Parliament, concentrating on your priorities.

politicalExperience.achievements: Cllr Faith Ponsonby with Steve. She said: "He will be a strong MP for Havant".

contactInformation.address: Havant Lib Dems, FREEPOST (RSHC-SJYT-JUAG), 25 Leigh Road, HAVANT, PO9 2ET

images.caption: Steve with Gina, a happy pensioner.
Steve's interaction with local residents and his engagement at social housing developments.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet includes bar graphs showing potential voting outcomes between Liberal Democrats and Conservatives, suggesting a tactical voting situation.
